message:
Great Article. Thanks very much!

I am a bit lost with a particular problem on a web api I am collaborating to. It wraps all endpoints in  
return Task.Factory.StartNew(() => {...});

Internally all endpoints behave similarly:  
1. Through the Web Api, an action is "queued" to the database and the request "waits", by periodically querying the database for the queued action. When it's completed the request returns the result.  
2. IoT devices connect to the same server asking for pending commands, executing and "completing" them.

This whole waiting does not seem correct, but to change it will take time in this project. So in the meantime I would like to tackle the Start New Task part. Is there something I could change?  
Thanks in advance! I know mine is a pretty general question. :)

By the way, the project uses ASP .NET Web API 4.0

Thanks a million!
